head.title: Taxes, Taxes, From the Workplace to the Grave

hedline.hl1: Taxes, Taxes, From the Workplace to the Grave

abstract.p: Phil Edmunds letter says estate tax violates two basic principles of tax fairness: that income can be taxed only once by a taxing authority and that capital gains cannot be taxed until they are realized (June 15 Repr Nydia M Velazquez Op-Ed)

block.p: Paul Krugman's assessment of the reality of the inheritance tax, and why the Republican leadership successfully fought to repeal it (column, June 14), was true, brave and long-overdue. With the slow death of liberalism in this country, Republicans have gotten a free ride lately on their endless love affair with the wealthy.

Paul Krugman's assessment of the reality of the inheritance tax, and why the Republican leadership successfully fought to repeal it (column, June 14), was true, brave and long-overdue. With the slow death of liberalism in this country, Republicans have gotten a free ride lately on their endless love affair with the wealthy.
It is time that we elected a Congress that will make the working class, the poor and the disfranchised a priority over those who need no further assistance.
